data.title: Press Enter to submit commit when enter message to commit
data.body: Replace new line feature when press Enter by submit commit

data.title: Emmet tab expansion problem
data.body:
By default the tab key should expand emmet.
This was not the case for me in VS Code. For example typing p followed by tab expanded to the word DOCTYPE

I went to Keyboard Shortcuts and set emmet.expandAbbreviation to tab.

I am now getting the Info message "Cannot resolve language at cursor" everytime I try to use tab key to expand emmet. 

I haven't installed any auto-completion Extensions so I don't understand why DOCTYPE is being suggested. 

The only way I have managed to get Emmet to work is to make the following user settings:

  // Configures if the built-in HTML language support suggests Ionic tags, properties and values.
  "html.suggest.ionic": false,
// Configures if the built-in HTML language support suggests HTML5 tags, properties and values.
  "html.suggest.html5": false,
  // Controls if suggestions should automatically show up when typing trigger characters
  "editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters": false,
    // Controls if quick suggestions should show up or not while typing
  "editor.quickSuggestions": false,

But with all this stuff set I no longer get suggestions for JavaScript!

data.title: CLI: Allow to open multiple folders in one workspace
data.body:
It would be nice to have a command line argument to open multiple folders provided in one workspace instead of multiple windows. 

There is some overlap with https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30598 and we have to decide if we want to keep one command line option for the same thing or not. Maybe the "`--new-window`" argument could be used to understand that the user wants to create a new workspace vs. adding to an existing workspace.

Another idea was to pick on the "`--reuse-window`" argument to decide if a workspace should get opened or not.

data.title: CLI: Allow to add additional folders to a workspace
data.body:
We should have a command that adds folders to a workspace that is opened.

One idea is to have `-a, --add <folders>` and a list of folders that will be added to the last active workspace. If no workspace is opened, we can open the last active one. If no workspace was ever created, we can create one with the list of folders.

data.title: Auto detected task name changed and lets npm PrelauchTask fail
data.body:
Setup:

- task auto detection in VS code 1.13. Detects grunt task name 'build'
- launch.json references the grunt task using `"preLaunchTask": "build"`.
- upgrade to 1.14
- pre lauch tasks failes.

The reason is that we now auto detect n build systems in parallel and therefore qualify the name of the prelaunch task. To fix this change the property to `"preLaunchTask": "grunt: build"`.

Same is true for gulp and jake autodetected tasks.

We should document this in the release notes.



We should document this in the release notes.
--

data.title: Binding keyboard shortcuts to tasks doesn't work with tasks 2.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a task using 2.0 schema

```json
{
    "label": "open",
    "type": "npm",
    "script": "open",
    "problemMatcher": [
        "$tsc"
    ]
}
```

2. Add keyboard shortcut with task label as arg
```json
{
    "key": "shift+cmd+o",
    "command": "workbench.action.tasks.runTask",
    "args": "open"
}
```

3. Press keyboard shortcut. Nothing happens.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

root/src/**scripts**/index.ts
```
import * as all from 'MyModule'
```

If I rename the path ' root/src/scripts/index.ts' to  ' root/src/main/index.ts', it works well.

data.title: Cannot read property 'args' of undefined
Enlarge command pallete search
data.body: I could not find any setting that would make command palette search bigger, more like in atom or osx alfred app. I guess this is not so hard to implement if it is not already possible with some config tweaks.

data.title: Improve support for Linux shells under Windows

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Currently we make certain assumptions depending on the OS which are incorrect when running tasks in *nix shells under Windows (e.g. bash, Linux SubSystem, ...). These are:

- path separator
- folder paths

We should improve this.

data.title: After update to 1.14 word wrap doesn't work anymore
data.body:
After updating vscode to 1.14, word wrap does not work anymore.
I tried toggling it with alt+Z, the menu item and the command palette command, none of these worked.

- VSCode Version: 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40)
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. mmmh upgrade to 1.14.0 from - I guess - 1.13.x. I had word wrap enabled at the time of upgrade. I used the automatic upgrade functionality of vscode.

2. try toggling wordwrap on and off

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Debugging nodemon with the internalConsole causing exception
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0 (This was fine in the previous version)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04
- Node Version: v4.4.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Run nodemon with the following configuration:
```js
{
            "protocol": "legacy",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Server (Nodemon)",
            "runtimeExecutable": "nodemon",
            "runtimeArgs": [
            ],
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "restart": true,
            "console": "internalConsole"
},
```
2. Make a change to a file and hit save.
3. Exception thrown.

Exception has occurred: Error
Error: write EPIPE
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:870:11)
    at WriteWrap.afterWrite (net.js:769:14)

data.title: "Dynamic" debug launch args in the UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (56a5bf1724f3b882e149a3e7a24e6105a7b837c2, 2017-07-13T06:29:54.260Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

It would be great if we could specify "args" for a debug configuration from a text entry box in the editor as well as setting them inside the launch.json entry. If you are working with many launch configurations then having to keep moving args around between them as you switch is a pain. A nice text entry box undernearth the config selector in the debug pane that injected its contents into the "args" field of the config as it was launched would be awesome.

Graeme

data.title: Cannot search for non-ASCII text in non-UTF-8 coded project files
data.body:

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.6.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create text file in project folder with Windows-1251 encoding.
2. Fill out text file with sample content (russian+english): "тест test тест".
3. Save and close text file.
4. Invoke search in project (CTRL+Shift+F) with search string "тест".
5. **Nothing found**.
6. Invoke search in project (CTRL+Shift+F) with search string "test".
7. Text found, strange symbols in preview: [link](https://i.imgur.com/YwlaYw5.png)
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

data.title: No progress visible if message length exceeds space
data.body:
The Java extension uses the `withProgress` API to run the potentially very long running 'Start Java Server' operation. As libraries need to be downloaded, this can last several minutes.

Problem is that the progress indication seems to go on and off
- If the message does not fit on the status line, nothing is shown, not even the turning wheel
- It appears that after a time out and no change the message also disappears (I'm not sure about this one, maybe it's also just that message gets longer)

It would be good if the message could be cropped and that the turning wheel stays visible so that the user knows that the initialization is still ongoing.

data.title: Type intellisense in javascript is missing in 1.14.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 
- OS Version: Ubuntu 17.04
- Extensions: I had try disabled all extensions for verifying this problem is not caused by extension

---

Before upgraded VS Code to 1.14.0 . I usually write javascript codes with jsDoc (such as "@type" "@param" "@returns" and more) for getting better intellisense in javascript file.

But I found the type intellisense in **1.14.0** is missing, like follow screenshot:

![2017-07-13 14-38-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4303130/28153622-ef253532-67d8-11e7-963c-4aa3bc7c6304.png)

I mark this variable `a` type as `GameController`(I declare this type in `src/main/index.d.ts`). But I could not get any intellisense when I type `GameController`.

--- 

But same code in VS Code **1.13.1**. I could get intellisense around `GameController`, like this:

![2017-07-13 14-41-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4303130/28153685-6bb61030-67d9-11e7-848d-4fcb4bbcaf6f.png)

(P.s. This type intellisense missing is occurred for all type included basic type (number, string, Function ...)

Are you removed this intellisense in 1.14.0? Or it is a bug?   
I could only downgrade version to 1.13.1 to obtain this intellisense now.

Thanks for reading.

data.title: feature request: possibility to disable auto update for certain extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

The autoupdate feature for extensions is a huge plus! I just have a minor issue with it. When you develop an extension, and the package.json version does not exactly match (or semver check?) it downloads the "newer" version. Despite the fact that I'm on my latest development branch locally.

![fikqqvd4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1067213/28152957-5501f75e-67a3-11e7-9b1b-893f91cce47d.png)

It would be a really cool feature to disable auto update (maybe with a setting or a file or whatever) for that specific extension locally, since it's compiled on my machine and loaded via a symbolic link.

An annoying workaround would be to fill in the package.json version every time. But since someone may use semantic releasing (like I do), that's kind of a downer.

Cheers!

data.title: Spam Error: TextEditor disposed
data.body:
Our tests and also often the dev console are full of these errors:

```
Error: TextEditor disposed
    at MainThreadEditors.$trySetDecorations (file:///Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/workbench/api/electron-browser/mainThreadEditors.js:144:56)
    at MainThreadService.AbstractThreadService.handle (file:///Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/workbench/services/thread/common/abstractThreadService.js:25:27)
    at invokeHandler (file:///Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/platform/extensions/common/ipcRemoteCom.js:202:53)
    at receiveOneMessage (file:///Users/travis/build/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/platform/extensions/common/ipcRemoteCom.js:166:36)
    at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:67:7)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:98:9)
```

I see no value in showing this error other than making it hard to read the test results to find an actual problem. This one seems to be ignored for many releases now so I suggest to remove it.

E.g.:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/28151198-7e8d8c3c-6799-11e7-80ec-6520eac8663b.png)

via https://travis-ci.org/Microsoft/vscode/jobs/253065123#L3436

data.title: Add setting to show cross project find results in a tab like Sublime
data.body:
VSCode shows the find results squished into a narrow sidebar which makes them very hard to use if your window and sidebar isn't huge. You also can't have the find results and the file view at the same time, since the actions sidebar only lets you see one thing at a time.

Instead have a mode where the find results are a regular tab. Then you could tear it off, or toggle back and forth from code windows while the file view is still open and also have lots more room to see the find results. Also provide control over the number of context lines shown there.

data.title: Allow setting for git gutters to show difference to upstream

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The git gutters today are showing uncommitted changes against HEAD, but it's often really nice to see differences from the branch upstream since many large projects and companies work on lots of small commits locally and then upload to a codereview solution which does a squash on them into a single commit when landing (ex. gerritt, phabricator, google internal things).

Ideally you could set a mode where your gutters were showing the diff from origin/master, or whatever the upstream was so I know what the squashed commit will do upon landing. Today I need to manually run "git diff origin/master" or use a side by side diff tool. Instead I'd like all my editor windows to show the blue/red gutters as I'm editing, even if I've committed it as intermediate code on the branch.

data.title: Sort by `type` doesn't affect folders
data.body: This PR addresses the discussion (here #29509) around sorting by `type` and weather it should or should not affect folders
